Hermès 2020 Performance Analysis Jen Wang, Wenjie Wei and Yinqiu Feng 2021-04-11 Chapter 1 Introduction Hermès, a renowned French luxury goods manufacturer established in 1837, specializes in leather goods, fine jewelry, clothes, home furniture, and lifestyle accessories. Interestingly, Hermès is where you can’t even walk into a boutique and buy a bag with a five figure price immediately. You can’t buy almost all the handbags in iconic styles online neither. They only sell iconic bags such as Birkin, Kelly and Constance to customers who have been established a extensive purchase history and each customer can only purchase one iconic bag in every six months. This famous “Anti Marketing” strategy which focuses on exclusivity, scarcity and craftsmanship was very successful in the past decades. While so many retails stores were heavily affected by the unprecedented health and economic crisis in year 2020, we are interested to explore whether this leading luxury brand still outperformed and demonstrated its business strategy strength, ability to adapt and the agility. In this project, we would like to evaluate Hermès’ performance in 2020 by exploring its regional performance, sectoral performance and retail stores growth, analyzing its financial statements (income statement and balance sheet), and stock information.

Chapter 2 Data sources We obtained the data mainly from Hermès Finance Website. Since our primary focus was how an unprecedented health and economic crisis in 2020 effect Hermès performance, we pays more attention on comparing Hermès’ data in 2019 and in 2020. From Hermès’ Annual Reports and Quarterly Reports, we were able to gather Hermès’ Revenue Analysis, Store Allocation as well as Financial Statements: 1. Revenue by Geographical Area Quarterly and annually revenue analysis by geographical area in fiscal year 2019 and 2020 divide the total revenue into Europe(France and the rest of Europe), Asia(Japan and the rest of Asia), Americas and Other. 2. Store Allocation We crapped global Hermès store allocation data from 2020 Universal Document. Since our focus is on Hermès’ performance in 2020, we also collected data of new stores that was opened in year 2020. 3. Revenue by Sector Quarterly and annually revenue analysis by sector in fiscal year 2019 and 2020 divide the total revenue into seven business sectors: Leather Goods and Saddlery, Ready-to-Wear and Accessories, Silk and Textiles, Other Hermès sectors (Jewelry and home products), Perfumes, Watches as well as Other products (Sub-brand products). As we all know Hermès focuses on exclusivity, scarcity, craftsmanship with it’s renowned “Anti Marketing” strategy, customers are required to establish a solid purchase history before getting a Hermès handbag (Birkin, Kelly, Constance and etc.). Revenue by sector analysis gives us a sense of how much an average customer need to spend in Hermès’ non leather goods in order to get a Hermès bag. 4. Key Figures The Key Figures table in Hermès’ quarterly and annually reports include important variables that illustrate Hermès’ performance such as recurring operating income, number of employees, equity and etc. We would like to see if there is any variable shows interesting pattern from 2019 to 2020. 5. 2019 & 2020 Financial Statements Financial Statements contains valuable information about a company’s performance. We obtained Hermès’ Income Statement and Balance Sheet in year 2019 and 2020 from Hermès annual reports. 6. Stock Information We would like to see how did Hermès’ stock prices perform comparing to other relative stock prices such as stock market index and relative French based luxury goods corporations’ stock. We obtained French Stock Index, S&P 500, LVMH(owns LV, Loewe, Dior etc.) stock and Kering(owns Gucci, Balenciaga, YSL and etc.) stock using quantmod package in R. One issue we faced when collecting data was that all data available was in pdf format. We managed to solve this problem by data scrapping using pdftools package.

Chapter 3 Data transformation 3.1 d3 data 1. Revenue by Geographical Area Eliminate total and subtotal revenue of area and keep all revenues value of smallest region unit in numeric type. And convert wide data to long data by using tidy verse. After preprocessing all quarters data, concatenate all quarter’s data with which quarter specified. 2. Store Allocation To be compatible with the region name in the maps package, we change the country name of United Kingdoms and Monaco. And We also include the caribbean in Americas, Hong Kong and Macao in China to match the boundary in package. 3. Revenue by Sector Convert all revenues value to numeric type and eliminate total and subtotal revenue of sectors. Also rename sectors name by eliminating footnote. Then convert wide data to long data by using tidy verse. After preprocessing all quarters data, concatenate all quarter’s data with which quarter specified. 4. Key Figures First, we select the important variables that we want to discuss in key figures. Then we transfer the row name into date column. Because these metrics all have different units, and it will be meaningless to put them together in one plot, we decide to transfer all values into index in a way it can provide a better comparison. 5. 2019 & 2020 Financial Statements For income statement, we only extract the expense, income, and final net profit. Since we would like to show the flow of revenue and compare the final profit between 2020 and 2019, we eliminate the subtotal. Also rename the name of income and expense could fit axis better and add a column of reference for waterfall plot. For balance Sheet, we combine the asset data from 2018 to 2020 together as the liability data from 2018 to 2020. Then we only include the major terms in balance sheet and merge the asset with liabilities. We transform the data frame into a better frame for plotting and replace the ‘,’ inside amount column. Hence, we can easily transfer the data type of value from character to numeric. 6. Stock Information Convert the date column into Date data type. Join all different stocks data together.Then, we can calculate the return rate by calculate the difference of prices between \(Day_t\) and \(Day_{t+1}\) and divide by the \(Price_t\). We assume the first day return to be 0.

Chapter 7 Conclusion In order to evaluate the performance of Hermès during pandemic, we analyzed the revenue by different factors, financial statement, key figure and stock price. By comparing the revenue geographically of Hermès in 2019 with that in 2020, we can get the conclusion that the Covid-19 have been negatively influenced revenue from all area except Asian at the first half year and recovered gradually at the last quarter year. The revenue from Asian has not been influenced at all and increase. The main consumer from Asian might be from China by looking at the stare global distribution where there are highest stores’ density in China. However, the growth of revenue in Asian does not make up the loss in other regions. In 2020 year, Hermès decreases 500 million EU compared with revenue in 2019. By saving in Selling, marketing and administrative expenses, they diminish this loss to 300 millions EU, final profit from 1500 millions EU to 1300 millions EU. However, those negative influence on revenues does not affect consumer’s passion to Hermès’s leather product which takes nearly half of revenue of Hermès. Although the Revenue and Recurring operating decrease and back to 2018 level, the workforce of company is keeping same increase rate which represent the growth of Hermès company is not affected by Covid-19. Also, we can check that the total asset of Hermès increased as well, and the stockholder equality increase as well. And the stockholder also shows large market confidence on Hermès. During pandemic period, although the stock price of Hermès fluctuates with market, it still shows relative static compared with other luxury stock. From overall, although Hermès’s revenue has been impacted by Covid-19, their customers’ loyalty shows great confidence in the future. The group remains highly committed and active, and gradually adapts measures to those taken by health and public authorities.
